content: In the context of job description or job advertisements, explain what ${category} bias and non-inclusive language is.

Disability bias and non-inclusive language in job descriptions involve the use of terms or requirements that inadvertently exclude or disadvantage individuals based on disabilities, which can include physical, mental, sensory, or cognitive impairments.

Applicants should have excellent organisational and communication skills, along with a solid background in project management. We welcome candidates with various levels of experience and from all educational backgrounds. Our inclusive workplace values diverse perspectives and is committed to providing equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants from any location to apply, as we offer flexible working arrangements to accommodate different needs and preferences. This role requires the ability to collaborate effectively with team members, adapt to evolving priorities, and guide projects to completion with thoughtful oversight. If you are motivated by challenging work and passionate about making a meaningful impact, we would love to hear from you.
